perturbation.original_text: PrimeCall and DeltaThree each agree that for the longest period permitted by law each shall hold in strictest confidence and, without the prior written approval of the other party hereto, not to use for their own benefit or the benefit of any party other than the other party hereto, or disclose to any person, firm or corporation other than such party (other than as required by law) any confidential proprietary information concerning the business and affairs of the other party hereto; provided, however, that the foregoing limitations and restrictions shall not apply to information that (i) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the directors, officers, shareholders, partners, affiliates, employees, agents or advisors of PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, or (ii) is or becomes available to PrimeCall or DeltaThree on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the other party hereto or any of its advisors, agents or affiliates, provided that such source is not known by PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, to be bound by a confidentiality agreement with or other obligation of secrecy to the other party hereto. Each of PrimeCall and DeltaThree recognize that the absence of a time limitation in this Section 8.01  [Confidentiality] is reasonable and properly required for the protection of the other party hereto and in the event that the absence of such limitation is deemed to be unreasonable by a court of competent jurisdiction, PrimeCall and DeltaThree each agree and submit to the imposition of such a limitation as said court shall deem reasonable.
perturbation.changed_text: PrimeCall and DeltaThree each agree that each shall hold in strictest confidence and, without the prior written approval of the other party hereto, not to use for their own benefit or the benefit of any party other than the other party hereto, or disclose to any person, firm or corporation other than such party (other than as required by law) any confidential proprietary information or trade secrets concerning the business and affairs of the other party hereto; provided, however, that the foregoing limitations and restrictions shall not apply to information that (i) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the directors, officers, shareholders, partners, affiliates, employees, agents or advisors of PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, or (ii) is or becomes available to PrimeCall or DeltaThree on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the other party hereto or any of its advisors, agents or affiliates, provided that such source is not known by PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, to be bound by a confidentiality agreement with or other obligation of secrecy to the other party hereto. Each of PrimeCall and DeltaThree recognize that the absence of a time limitation in this Section 8.01  [Confidentiality] is reasonable and properly required for the protection of the other party hereto and in the event that the absence of such limitation is deemed to be unreasonable by a court of competent jurisdiction, PrimeCall and DeltaThree each agree and submit to the imposition of such a limitation as said court shall deem reasonable.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to 'confidential proprietary information.' The modified version introduces 'trade secrets' alongside. Without defining 'trade secrets' and whether they are distinct from 'confidential proprietary information', it creates ambiguity. This ambiguity could lead to disputes about which information is protected, especially if the legal definitions of 'confidential information' and 'trade secrets' differ significantly.

perturbation.original_text: PrimeCall may assign this Agreement to any affiliate of PrimeCall or in connection with a merger or consolidation of PrimeCall or a sale of all or substantially all of PrimeCall's business. Except as provided in the preceding sentence, this Agreement may not be assigned by PrimeCall without the prior written consent of DeltaThree.
perturbation.changed_text: PrimeCall may transfer this Agreement to any subsidiary of PrimeCall or in connection with a merger or acquisition of PrimeCall or a sale of PrimeCall's assets. Except as provided in the preceding sentence, this Agreement may not be assigned by PrimeCall without the prior written consent of DeltaThree.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'assign' and 'affiliate,' whereas the modified version introduces 'transfer,' 'subsidiary,' and 'acquisition.' The terms 'assign' and 'transfer' are used interchangeably and without definition, causing confusion as to whether the original restriction on assignment is still valid with a 'transfer.' 'Affiliate' is replaced by 'subsidiary' and 'merger' with 'acquisition,' potentially narrowing/broadening the scope of permissible transfers without DeltaThree's consent, generating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
In the event that either PrimeCall or DeltaThree materially breaches any of its duties or obligations hereunder, which breach shall not be cured within thirty (30) days after written notice is given to the breaching party specifying the breach, then either PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, may, by giving written notice thereof to the other, terminate this Agreement as of a date specified in such notice of termination, which

date shall be no earlier than ten (10) days after the date of such notice.
perturbation.changed_text:
In the event that either PrimeCall or DeltaThree materially defaults any of its duties or responsibilities hereunder, which default shall not be rectified within thirty (30) days after written notification is given to the defaulting party specifying the non-compliance, then either PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, may, by giving written notification thereof to the other, cancel this Agreement as of a date specified in such notification of cancellation, which

date shall be no earlier than ten (10) days after the date of such notification.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to 'breaches', 'duties', and 'obligations', the modified version replaces 'breaches' with 'defaults,' 'duties' with 'responsibilities,' 'cure' with 'rectified,' 'notice' with 'notification' and 'terminate' with 'cancel'. By changing the verbage without a clear definition of the context, it is not clear whether the original terms mean the same thing, or the new verbiage expands or limits the initial scope of the contract.
